Killing all enemies in the marked order will grant Isaac with a random reward.
If a non-marked enemy is killed, the skull will disappear and no bonus will be granted for that room.
Marked enemies are chosen starting from the top-left corner of the room. New enemies spawned afterward are added at the end of the list
Rooms with no enemies (e.g. only a button) will also give rewards.
Possible rewards:
• +0.2 speed.
• +0.5 range.
• +0.5 fire rate.
• +0.2 shot speed.
• +1 damage.
• +1 luck.
• Soul Heart.
• Pill.
• Key.
• Bomb.
• Nickel.

haemolacria.name: Haemolacria
haemolacria.description:
+1 damage.
×1.5 damage multiplier.
x1.71 tear size multiplier.
x2 tear delay + 10.
x0.8 range multiplier.
Makes Isaac's tears fire in an arc, and burst into 6-11 smaller tears in all directions upon hitting something or falling to the ground.
The burst tears' damage varies from 50-83.33% of the main tear, averaging at ~67% damage.
Shot speed affects the arc oppositely. Higher shot speed lowers the arc, while lower shot speed heightens it.

lachryphagy.name: Lachryphagy
lachryphagy.description:
Grants Isaac hungry tears that decelerate as they travel. Upon stopping or hitting something, they burst into 5-8 tears (based on tear size) in all directions that deal half of the main tear's damage.
Tears can be fired into each other in order to feed them, increasing their size and damage.
One tear can be fed up to 5 times before bursting.
Combined tears' damage gets added up together, with the first consumed tear giving additional damage.
Familiars' tears can also feed Isaac's tears.
Tear bursting is also affected by tear size. With big enough tear size, tears will burst immediately after firing.

trisagion.name: Trisagion
trisagion.description:
Replaces Isaac's tears with piercing white beams of light that deal 33% of Isaac's damage, but can hit the same enemy multiple times.
Beams decrease in size until disappearing.
Lower shot speed is more beneficial as it can cause enemies to get hit more times.
Beams can hit enemies through obstacles, but only when passing through only 1 obstacle.

blanket.name: Blanket
blanket.description:
+1 Soul Heart.
Heals 1 red heart container.
Grants a one-time-use Holy Mantle shield upon entering a Boss Room, that blocks one hit.
The shield is only active within the Boss Room and cannot be carried over to a different room.
Re-entering the Boss Room will renew the shield.
In Greed Mode, the shield will only activate in The Shop floor final boss fights.

schoolbag.name: Schoolbag
schoolbag.description:
Allows Isaac to carry 2 active items at once.
Items can be swapped through by using the drop button.
Items in the secondary slot will recharge at the same rate as the primary item.

sacrificial altar.name: Sacrificial Altar
sacrificial altar.description:
Sacrifices up to 2 of Isaac's familiars chosen at random, and spawns an item from a preset devil-deal-like list for each of them.
Converts specific familiars:
• Blue Flies, Blue Spiders, Clots, Locusts, Friendly Dips and Minisaacs into Pennies 
• Book of Virtues wisps into Half Hearts 
• Lemegeton wisps into Half Soul Hearts 
Causes a brief Curse of Darkness! .
Cannot sacrifice Incubus when playing as Lilith .
Can sacrifice familiars granted from trinkets, destroying the trinket in the process.
If an angelic familiar is sacrificed ( Guardian Angel / Seraphim / Sworn Protector ), 2 Black Hearts will drop as well.
If Isaac already has all items that can be spawned, it will instead spawn 1-2 copies of Pentagram .

lil spewer.name: Lil Spewer
lil spewer.description:
Spawns a random pill.
Spawns a familiar that follows Isaac. It charges up for 1 second and fires different types of creep based on his appearance that changes when Isaac uses a pill.
Possible creep types:
• Green: deals 0.35 damage per tick (10.5 per second) - total 35.
• Red: deals 12 damage per tick (120 per second) - total 24.
• Yellow: 2 damage per tick at its lowest range, up to 15.2 damage at its furthest range (~6.47 damage per second, based on range). Damage ticks for a total of 9 times.
• Black /White: slows enemies down.
The familiar always starts with green creep.
Has a 1% chance of being dropped upon defeating Blastocyst.

mystery egg.name: Mystery Egg
mystery egg.description:
Spawns an egg familiar that follows Isaac. It cracks and turns into a random friendly enemy when Isaac is hurt.
Regenerates upon entering a different room.
Clearing more rooms without the egg cracking will results in more useful friendly enemies spawned. The most useful enemies are spawned after clearing more than 13 rooms without taking damage.

marbles.name: Marbles
marbles.description:
On pickup Spawns 3 random trinkets.
While held Grants a 10% chance to swallow Isaac's currently held trinket(s) upon taking damage, gaining its effects permanently.

slipped rib.name: Slipped Rib
slipped rib.description:
Spawns an orbital familiar that reflects enemy projectiles, making them deal 6 or 7 damage based on whether they would've hurt Isaac for a half or full heart.
The familiar will insta-kill some fly enemies.

flat stone.name: Flat Stone
flat stone.description: Causes Isaac's tears to bounce off the floor multiple times, dealing splash damage to nearby enemies for 25% of Isaac's damage.

hallowed ground.name: Hallowed Ground
hallowed ground.description:
Spawns a white poop familiar that follows Isaac and turns into a white poop when Isaac is hurt.
White poop has an aura that grants ×1.2 damage multiplier, ×2.5 fire rate multiplier, homing tears, and has a 50% chance to negate damage.
Can be used to negate damage from Devil Beggars , Blood Donation Machines , and similar self-sacrifice mechanics.
White poop cannot be destroyed from enemy projectiles and charging attacks.
The familiar respawns after leaving the room.

book of the dead.name: Book of the Dead
book of the dead.description:
Spawns one of the following for each enemy killed in the current room:
• Orbital bone familiar (very common).
• Friendly Bony (uncommon).
• Friendly Bone Fly (uncommon).
• Friendly Black Bony (rare).
• Friendly Revenant (rare - more common in Mausoleum, Gehenna, Sheol, and Dark Room).
Spawning a different enemy other than a Bony is only possible after dying at least once to said enemy on the save file.
Has a 1% chance of being dropped upon defeating The Forsaken.

pointy rib.name: Pointy Rib
pointy rib.description:
Spawns a familiar that can be aimed with the firing buttons in all directions, and deals contact damage.
Damage dealt is equal to Isaac's tear damage and is dealt 4.29 times per second.
The damage increases when Isaac is moving in the direction the familiar is pointing at, and it scales with the speed Isaac is currently moving at, going up to 2x its base damage.

divorce papers.name: Divorce Papers
divorce papers.description:
+1 Bone Heart .
+0.7 tears.
Spawns Mysterious Paper if unlocked and not previously encountered during the run.

jaw bone.name: Jaw Bone
jaw bone.description:
Spawns a familiar that follows Isaac and glides across the room in the direction of the first tear fired and returns to Isaac upon hitting a wall.
The familiar deals 7 contact damage to enemies and will pierce through them if it kills them, or bounce back if it doesn't.
Can block enemy projectiles, even when stationary.
Can retrieve pickups.

dad s ring.name: Dad's Ring
dad s ring.description:
Creates a ring of light around Isaac that petrifies enemies it touches.
Bosses get a standard petrification effect that lasts for a few seconds, while non-boss enemies stay permanently petrified while inside the ring.

brittle bones.name: Brittle Bones
brittle bones.description:
On pickup +6 Bone Hearts .
Removes all Red Heart containers and empties all Bone Hearts.
While held Losing any Bone heart causes Isaac to fire a ring of 8 bones that deal 22 + DamageStat damage and split into more bones that deal damage half of this amount.
Losing a Bone Heart also grants a permanent +0.4 fire rate.
No effects are applied when losing Bone Hearts via a Devil Deal or other means that don't involve directly taking damage.
Has a 1% chance of being dropped upon defeating The Frail.

broken shovel.name: Broken Shovel
broken shovel.description:
Can be acquired by defeating the first floor boss under a minute (indicated by Mom yelling "Isaac!").
Bombing the starting room of the floor after defeating the boss will drop the item. If Isaac has no bomb, the Sacrifice Room can be used which will guarantee a bomb drop on the first sacrifice.
The Lamb must be defeated at least once in order for the item to appear.
Forms Mom's Shovel when combined with the other piece of the shovel.
While held Causes 1-2 Mom's feet to attempt to stomp Isaac every few seconds. Each stomp deals a full heart of damage to Isaac if successful, and 100 damage to enemies.
Stomps will not blow up Slot Machines or Beggars, but will destroy obstacles, Bomb Chests, and will open doors.
The stomps cease while fighting Mom.
Removes the 20 minute time limit on the Boss Rush door, but forces Isaac to complete Boss Rush before advancing to the next floor.
Forces The Negative to appear after defeating Mom, ultimately leading Isaac to Sheol.
If the item is dropped, leaving the room will cause it to disappear.
On use Pauses stomps for the current room.
If used in Boss Rush or a Challenge Room, stomps will be paused for only a single wave.

mucormycosis.name: Mucormycosis
mucormycosis.description:
Grants a 25% chance to shoot a spore tear that sticks to enemies and explodes after 2.5 seconds.
The explosion deals 5 damage and poisons nearby enemies, firing 4 more spores in a cross pattern.
The poison deals Isaac's amount of damage for a total of 6 times.
Spores produced from Isaac's tears have homing properties.
Spores cannot hurt Isaac.

golden razor.name: Golden Razor
golden razor.description:
On pickup +5¢.
On use Consumes 5¢ and grants +1.2 damage for the current room.
Does nothing if Isaac has less than 5¢.

mom s shovel.name: Mom's Shovel
mom s shovel.description:
Spawns a trapdoor that leads to the next floor.
If used on a tile with a special graphic (e.g. grass, piece of garbage, etc), it will instead spawn a Crawl Space once per floor.
If used in Womb II, the trapdoor will always lead to Sheol.
Can only spawn a Crawl Space trapdoor if used in any floor after Womb. Regular trapdoors won't be spawned in these floors.
Using it on a dirt patch that appears in Grave Rooms in the Dark Room will unlock The Forgotten . If already unlocked, will spawn a random chest instead.

2spooky.name: 2Spooky
2spooky.description:
+0.5 fire rate.
+0.2 shot speed.
Constantly applies fear to enemies near Isaac, causing them to run away.

fortune cookie.name: Fortune Cookie
fortune cookie.description:
Gives one of the following:
• Random fortune (69.5% chance).
• Soul Heart (15% chance).
• Card or Rune (12% chance).
• Random trinket (3.5% chance).

sulfur.name: Sulfur
sulfur.description:
Grants Brimstone for the current room.
If Sulfur has already been used in the current room, or Isaac has Brimstone, it instead grants +1 damage, ×1.2 damage multiplier, and widens the laser for the current room.

eye sore.name: Eye Sore
eye sore.description: Grants Isaac a random chance to fire 1-3 additional tears in random directions when shooting.

120 volt.name: 120 Volt
120 volt.description:
Repeatedly zaps enemies near Isaac with electricity beams that deal 75% of Isaac's damage.
Enemies can be zapped up to 5 times per second.
Each zap can hit up to 4 enemies.
Arcing distance is increased on wet floors, such as Downpour, Flooded Caves, Dross, some rooms in Scarred Womb, as well as when using Flush! 
It's possible to zap an enemy standing directly on the other side of an obstacle.

it hurts.name: It Hurts
it hurts.description:
Causes Isaac to release a ring of 10 tears upon taking damage, and gain a fire rate increase for the current room.
Each tear in the ring deals 10 damage and does not inherit Isaac's tear effects.
The first hit taken in a room grants +1.2 fire rate, while each subsequent hit grants +0.4 fire rate.
The tears also leave damaging red creep when they land that deals 2 damage per tick (20 per second), and lasts for 5 seconds.
The fire rate boost can be stacked indefinitely.

almond milk.name: Almond Milk
almond milk.description:
×4 fire rate multiplier.
×0.3 damage multiplier.
-0.16 tear size.
Causes each tear fired to gain a random worm trinket effect, as well as some item effects such as Rubber Cement , My Reflection and Tiny Planet .

rock bottom.name: Rock Bottom
rock bottom.description:
Locks Isaac's stats to their highest values reached after picking up the item, preventing stats from ever going down.
The real values of Isaac's stats are still being calculated in the background, but only the highest values are applied.
For example, using The Book of Belial would normally grant +2 damage for the current room. Rock Bottom allows this bonus to be carried over for the rest of the run. However, since the original damage is calculated in the background, Isaac will have to earn more than +2 damage from other items in order to see an increase in overall damage.
It is recommended to stack as many temporary buffs at once as possible in order to reach high stat values.
Taking items that lower your stats may seem to not have an effect, but due to background calculation, doing this will make it more difficult to reach higher stats on the long run.

nancy bombs.name: Nancy Bombs
nancy bombs.description:
+5 Bombs.
Isaac's bombs gain 1-4 random bomb synergies (mostly 1).
Can also apply the effects of Bob's Bladder , Strange Attractor and Golden Bombs (only visual effect).

paschal candle.name: Paschal Candle
paschal candle.description:
Spawns a familiar that follows Isaac and grants +0.4 fire rate for each room cleared in a row without taking damage.
The bonus can stack up to 5 times, giving a total of +2 fire rate. This is represented by the flame burning at its brightest.
The bonus resets immediately upon taking damage, unless damage is taken from self-sacrifice mechanics, such as Curse Rooms, Blood Donation Machines , etc.

blood puppy.name: Blood Puppy
blood puppy.description:
Spawns a familiar that chases nearby enemies, dealing 2 damage per tick (8.57 per second)
The familiar will evolve 2 times after killing some enemies.
Each boss killed by Blood Puppy counts as killing 4 non-boss enemies.
After killing 15 enemies 
Blood Puppy deals 7.5 damage per tick (16.07 per second) to enemies.
It will charge at enemies that are aligned with it in the cardinal directions, dealing 90 damage per second while charging.
Drops a Half Red Heart for every 10 enemies it kills.
Becomes hostile and will charge at Isaac if aligned with him, dealing half a heart of damage.
Can be damaged by Isaac to return it back to normal after it takes enough damage. It has 20 health points + 90 armor.
After killing 25 more enemies (40 total) 
Increases in size and deals 15 damage per tick (150 per second).
Destroys obstacles it runs into while charging.
Deals a full heart of damage to Isaac.
Drops a full Red Heart after every 10 kills.
Has 50 health points + 90 armor.

dream catcher.name: Dream Catcher
dream catcher.description:
+1 Half Soul Heart each floor.
Changes the nightmare cutscene that plays during floor transitions. It will now show the item that will be found in the upcoming Treasure Room, as well as the floor's boss.
It will also reveal items during Curse of the Blind! , as well as the second hidden item on alternate floors.
Both items and bosses are shown during Curse of the Labyrinth! .
Cannot show glitched items generated by TMTRAINER .
Will show a poop in the Treasure Room if there are no item pedestals inside it.
In The Void, it will list all possible bosses found on the floor.
Prevents the nightmare cutscene from being skipped.

divine intervention.name: Divine Intervention
divine intervention.description:
Double-tapping a fire button creates a shield that slowly moves in the chosen direction and disappears after 1 second.
The shield has a variety of effects as listed below.
It will push back enemies, causing them to take damage upon hitting a wall or enemy, as well as deal damage to hit enemies. Both damage amounts are equal to 10 + 2 × CurrentFloor .
It will reflect back enemy tears, dealing damage to enemies depending on the source of the tear. Damage is 6 for tears that would deal half a heart of damage to Isaac, and 7 if they would deal a full heart.
Reflected projectiles do not inherit Isaac's tear effects.
It can also reflect enemy lasers, dealing 7 damage per tick (105 per second). It is also capable of reflecting The Beast's laser.

blood oath.name: Blood Oath
blood oath.description:
Spawns a familiar that follows Isaac and stabs him at the beginning of the each floor if he has more than half a red heart.
The familiar will drain as much red hearts as possible without killing Isaac, ultimately leaving him at half a red heart, or no red hearts at all if he has other types of hearts that will keep him alive.
When stabbed, Isaac gains increased stats for the rest of the floor: +0.15 × HeartsLost ^ 2 worth of damage, and +0.1 × HeartsLost worth of speed.
Even though a single stab animation, every bit of damage taken is treated separately per half a heart lost, which can lead to synergies with some items.

playdough cookie.name: Playdough Cookie
playdough cookie.description:
Causes every tear fired by Isaac to have a different color and corresponding effect:
• Light Brown: none.
• Green: poison.
• Yellow: fear.
• Blue: chance for Proptosis , but start at x1 damage instead of x3.
• Light Blue: slowing effect, and freeze on kill.
• Pink: charm.
• Red: double damage, petrifying effect, or Fire Mind .
• Purple: homing.
• Dark Orange: mark effect (forces enemies to attack the marked enemy).

orphan socks.name: Orphan Socks
orphan socks.description:
+2 Soul Hearts.
+0.3 speed.
Grants immunity to spikes on the ground and creep.
Does not prevent damage from Curse Rooms, Spiked Chests, or Spiked Rocks, but prevents damage from Spiked Rock bridges.
Does not prevent the use of a Sacrifice Room - these spikes will still deal damage.

eye of the occult.name: Eye of the Occult
eye of the occult.description:
+1 damage.
+2 range.
-0.16 shot speed.
Isaac's tears no longer move on their own and can be controlled mid-air with the shooting buttons.
Has a 1% chance of being dropped upon defeating The Adversary.

immaculate heart.name: Immaculate Heart
immaculate heart.description:
+1 full Red Heart container.
×1.2 damage multiplier.
Fully heals Isaac.
Causes Isaac to frequently fire additional spectral tears that orbit around him until they hit the ground. These tears inherit most tear effects.

monstrance.name: Monstrance
monstrance.description:
Creates a large pulsing aura around Isaac that damages enemies inside of it.
The aura's damage scales as enemies get closer towards the inside of the aura, ranging from 0.4 on the edge, up to 3.9 + 0.3 × CurentFloor .
The aura deals damage 7.5 times per second.

dirty mind.name: Dirty Mind
dirty mind.description:
Converts all enemy Dips and Drips into Dip familiars.
Grants a chance to replace rocks with poop when generated.
Causes poops to spawn 1-4 Dip familiars when destroyed, which will loosely follow Isaac, block enemy projectiles, and deal contact damage to enemies equal to 2x Isaac's damage.
Dips can deal up to 2 ticks of contact damage and/or block 2 shots before dying.
Different poop variants grant different types of Dip familiars.
Dip variants based on destroyed poop 
• Corny Poop: Dips spawn a Blue Fly on death.
• Red Poop: Dips deal double damage and charge at enemies, but automatically die after 15 seconds.
• Golden Poop: Dips have a chance to inflict Midas' Touch on enemies they hit. They can take up to 5 hits before dying.
• Rainbow Poop: Dips charm enemies they hit and have a chance to drop half red hearts on death.
• Black Poop: Dips leave a trail of slowing creep on the ground.
• White Poop: Dips have the Hallowed Ground aura around them, and can take up to 3 hits.
• Stone Poop: Dips deal an additional 3.5 damage per hit, and can take up to 6 hits.
• Stinky Poop: Dips release toxic gas as they move, and a larger cloud of gas upon death. The gas does 50% of Isaac's damage per tick (~1.2x Isaac's damage per second) and poisons enemies. Clouds left behind while alive last 1.5 seconds, while the on-death cloud lasts 8 seconds.
• Fire Poop: Dips set enemies ablaze when hit, and leave behind a fire when they die. The burn deals 3.5 damage up to 6 times. The fire deals 8 damage at full durability, 6 after taking 1 hit, and 4 otherwise, for a total of 22 damage.
Has a 1% chance of being dropped upon defeating Brownie.

the intruder.name: The Intruder
the intruder.description:
Causes Isaac to fire 4 slowing tears in addition to his regular ones 0.68 times per second that deal 1.5 damage each.
Upon taking damage, there's a luck-based chance for Isaac's head to pop off and spawn Blue Spiders, releasing the intruder familiar.
The familiar will leap at enemies, dealing up to 4.5 contact damage depending on how fast it's moving, 4.29 times per second, and will fire 4 slowing tears instead of Isaac, 1.88 times per second.
The chance for the familiar to pop off goes up to 100% with 4 luck.
The familiar only lasts for the current room, and reattaches to Isaac upon entering a new room.

damocles.name: Damocles
damocles.description:
Summons a sword above Isaac's head. As long as the sword is active, all item pedestals become doubled, spawning an additional free item next to them. Both items can be taken.
It will also double items spawned via other means, e.g. via Machines, Beggars, via other items, cards, etc.
Will not double items spawned from chests, except for Mega Chests .
Will not double items that require payment, such as ones in Shops and Devil Deals.
The additional item is pulled from the current room's item pool, even if the original item was from another pool.
After Isaac gets hit once the item has been activated, the sword can fall at any time and instantly kill Isaac. Self-sacrifice mechanics won't activate this effect.
The sword has a 1/10000 chance every 4 frames to fall. This chance does not increase as more hits get taken.
The sword falling can be survived if Isaac has invincibility at the time, or if he has an extra life. No more extra items will spawn once the sword has fallen.

spirit sword.name: Spirit Sword
spirit sword.description:
Replaces Isaac's tears with a sword that can be swung in front of him. The sword deals 3 × DamageStat + 3.5 damage and knocks back enemies it hits and Isaac.
The sword has no fire rate limitation and can be swung as fast as the fire button can be pressed.
The sword can be used to collect pickups.
If Isaac's total health is equal to or greater than his number of red heart containers, the sword will fire a projectile when swung. This projectile deals DamageStat + 2 damage and has a cooldown of 2x Isaac's normal tear rate.
Holding an attack button charges a spin attack which damages all enemies around Isaac, deflects enemy projectiles, and launches a projectile regardless of Isaac's health.
The circular swing deals 8 × DamageStat + 10 damage, while the projectile created from it deals 4 × DamageStat + 4 .
The charge time is based on Isaac's tear stat, at ~4x Isaac's normal tear rate.
While charging, the sword will damage the first enemy that comes in contact with it, canceling the spin attack.

free lemonade.name: Free Lemonade
free lemonade.description:
Spawns a lemonade pool on the ground that deals 8 damage per tick (24 per second) and lasts for ~19 seconds.
Has a 1% chance of being dropped upon defeating Peep.

red key.name: Red Key
red key.description:
While held Indicates walls that can create a Red Room with a red outline.
On use Creates a Red Room when used next to one of the red outlines on walls.
Red Rooms are most commonly same as normal rooms, but with a 10% chance to be any type of special room instead. It can create these types of rooms:
• Angel Room
• Arcade
• Bedroom
• Curse Room
• Devil Room
• Dice Room
• Library
• Mini-Boss Room
• Planetarium
• Sacrifice Room
• Secret Room
• Shop
• Super Secret Room
• Treasure Room
• Vault
Rooms created by Red Key will always be 1x1 rooms with doors available on all sides.
If a door leads Isaac outside of the 13x13 playable area of the floor, it will take Isaac to the I AM ERROR room.
Since Secret Rooms cannot be overwritten by Red Key, the lack of an red outline can be used as an indicator that a Secret Room is possibly located behind the wall.
If a created Red Room is adjacent to the Ultra Secret Room, its entrance will immediately open along with a jingle sound.
Has no effect in Greed Mode and cannot normally be obtained there.
Can be used to open the hidden closet door in the Home level that unlocks the Tainted version for each character. If the character has already been unlocked, this room will contain Inner Child , or a Shopkeeper if not unlocked.

psy fly.name: Psy Fly
psy fly.description:
Spawns an orbital fly familiar that rapidly chases and blocks enemy shots.
After blocking a certain amount of shots, it enters a shot cooldown period where it only orbits around Isaac, but can still block shots.
The familiar deals 1 damage per tick (15 per second).

wavy cap.name: Wavy Cap
wavy cap.description:
+0.75 fire rate.
-0.03 speed.
Distorts the screen and background music.
The effects can be stacked multiple times, making the colors turn very bright and intense after multiple uses.
Each use increases the item's charge time which starts at 0.5 seconds and goes up to 15 seconds after the 9th use. After the 10th use, it will no longer recharge automatically over time.
Leaving the room doubles the speed penalty and multiplies the fire rate bonus by x0.4 for the uses in that room.
Clearing a room removes one use's worth of penalties and bonuses.

rocket in a jar.name: Rocket in a Jar
rocket in a jar.description:
+5 Bombs.
When placing a bomb while holding any fire button, an explosive rocket will be shot in the direction corresponding to the fire button held.
Rockets deal the same amount of damage as regular bombs and inherit bomb synergies.
Rockets are not affected by Isaac's shot speed.

book of virtues.name: Book of Virtues
book of virtues.description:
While held +25% chance for an Angel Room to appear after defeating a boss.
Guarantees the first deal encountered in a run to be an Angel Room.
Allows an Angel Room to spawn even if a Devil Deal was taken.
When used by itself 
Spawns an orbital wisp that fires spectral tears alongside Isaac, block shots and deals contact damage to enemies. It will get destroyed after taking enough damage.
A normal wisp is summoned in the middle ring, has 2 health points and tears that deal 3 damage. It deals contact damage equal to 2x Isaac's tear damage.
As the wisp takes damage, it shrinks in size.
While Isaac is invulnerable, wisps are also invulnerable.
Multiple wisps can be summoned at once, and are placed in 3 different rings around Isaac: inner ring (max 6 wisps), middle ring (max 8 wisps), and outer ring (max 12 wisps), for a total of 26 wisps.
If a new wisp is summoned while having the maximum number of wisps, the most damaged wisp or most old will get replaced.
When used with another item 
Picking up another active item while holding Book of Virtues will stack the new item on top of the book, essentially turning the book into a passive item.
Using the active item will spawn unique wisps that are different for each item. For more details about each active item's unique wisps, check out an active item page.
Unique wisps come with their own appearances, modified attributes and special effects.

alabaster box.name: Alabaster Box
alabaster box.description:
General information 
The item starts with no charges and cannot be charged by clearing rooms or picking up batteries. It can only be charged by picking up Soul Hearts. Each Half Soul Heart increases the charge by 1 and gets directly added to the box rather than going to Isaac's health bar.
Both Black Hearts and Soul Hearts can be used to recharge the box.
Taking a Devil Deal that requires Soul Hearts will take charges from the box before using Isaac's health. This also applies to The Lost .
On use Consumes the item and spawns 3 Soul Hearts and 2 items from the Angel Room item pool.
If a Devil Deal was previously taken, the reward is reduced to 2 Soul Hearts and 1 Angel Room item.
There's a small chance for each Soul Heart to be replaced with an Eternal Heart instead.

the stairway.name: The Stairway
the stairway.description:
Generates a ladder that leads to a special Angel Room Shop at the start of each floor.
These shops will always contain the following:
• An item from the Angel Room item pool.
• Eternal Heart.
• Soul Heart.
• Key.
• Holy Card.
• Angel statue that can be fought for a Key Piece.
• Beggar or Rotten Beggar next to the entrance.
• Confessional, if unlocked.
Items and pickups can be on sale just like in normal shops.
The ladder will disappear once Isaac leaves the starting room.
The ladder will also appear in Greed Mode.

sol.name: Sol
sol.description:
Shows the location of the Boss Room on the minimap.
After defeating the floor's boss 
+3 damage.
+1 luck.
Activates the effects of XIX - The Sun .
Fully recharges Isaac's active item.
Removes any curses.
These effects apply for the rest of the floor.

luna.name: Luna
luna.description:
Adds an extra Secret Room and Super Secret Room on each floor. Does not apply to the floor the item was picked up on.
Reveals one random Secret Room on the map on pickup, and at the start of each floor.
Secret Rooms will contain a shining beam of light that causes the following when entered:
• +1 Half Soul Heart.
• +1 fire rate for the first beam entered; +0.5 for all subsequent ones. Stat changes only apply for the current floor.
• Creates a strong shine around Isaac that is increased for every beam of light entered. It can be used to light up dark areas or fight the Curse of Darkness! .
Beams of light don't appear in Ultra Secret Rooms.
No additional Secret Rooms are added in Greed Mode, Blue Womb, the Ascent, and Home.

venus.name: Venus
venus.description:
+1 full Red Heart container.
Heals 1 additional Red Heart.
Continuously charms enemies near Isaac. The effect wears off quickly after enemies move away from Isaac.

terra.name: Terra
terra.description:
+1 damage.
Replaces Isaac's tears with rocks that deal extra knockback and have a chance to destroy doors and obstacles.
Rock tears deal varying damage between x0.5 and x2 Isaac's damage.
Tears can destroy the armor of Tuff Twins and The Shell, and bypasses Blasters' damage reduction.

mercurius.name: Mercurius
mercurius.description:
+0.4 speed.
Opens all normal doors after entering a room, along with the door Isaac came from. This allows Isaac to leave at any time without completing the room.
Does not open doors that require pickups to unlock, such as Treasure Rooms, Shops, etc.
Cannot open the Boss Rush door.

mars.name: Mars
mars.description:
Isaac can dash by double-tapping a direction key.
While dashing, Isaac is immune to all sources of damage, with the exception of self-sacrifice mechanics such as Devil Beggars and Blood Donation Machines . However, it can be used to enter Curse Rooms and open Spiked Chests for free.
He also gains 1 second of invulnerability after the dash.
The dash deals 4 × DamageStat + 8 damage.
The direction of the dash can be influenced by holding another movement button.
Hitting an obstacle while dashing knocks back Isaac and surrounding enemies. This might cause them to take damage if they collide with another enemy or an obstacle.
The knockback effect also creates a ring of fire in a small radius that deals 10 damage to enemies, and sets them on fire for 2~3 seconds.
The dash has a 3-second cooldown.

jupiter.name: Jupiter
jupiter.description:
+2 full Red Heart containers.
-0.3 speed.
Standing still causes Isaac to build up speed at a rate of +0.25 per second, up to a +0.5 total bonus.
Isaac Charges up while standing still. Moving releases a fart cloud that damages and poisons enemies that pass through it. This drains the speed buff at a rate of -0.25 per second. The clouds are active for the duration of the speed buff.
The fart cloud deals 50% of Isaac's damage per tick (150% per second), and lasts ~2.5 seconds.
Grants immunity to poison clouds.

saturnus.name: Saturnus
saturnus.description:
Creates a circle around Isaac that contains 7 orbiting spectral tears which copy Isaac's tear effects.
The tears deal 1.5 × DamageStat + 5 damage.
The tears fall to the ground after 13 seconds and are renewed upon entering a new room.
Enemy tears have a chance to be caught in the orbit, making them able to damage enemies. These tears disappear a shrot time after leaving the room.

uranus.name: Uranus
uranus.description:
Turns Isaac's tears into icicles that freeze non-boss enemies upon death, turning them into ice statues.
Prevents on-death effects from occurring, such as enemies firing tears on death, exploding, splitting into other enemies, etc.
Frozen enemies can be kicked which makes them slide and leave damaging creep across the room. They shatter and release 10 icicle tears in a circle upon hitting an enemy or a wall.
The on-shatter icicles will slow enemies for 4 seconds or turn them into more ice statues if they deal lethal damage. They deal damage equal to 6 + CurrentFloor , and don't inherit Isaac's tear effects.
The creep rapidly deals 2 damage per tick (20 per second).
Ice statues can be shattered if shot by 10 tears or enemy projectiles, or a single explosion.
Sliding statues deal 35 flat damage to enemies.

pluto.name: Pluto
pluto.description:
+0.7 tears.
-50% size.
-73% hitbox size.
Allows Isaac to squeeze between objects and makes some enemy shots pass over him, all as a result to his size decrease.

eye drops.name: Eye Drops
eye drops.description:
+40% fire rate to tears fired from the left eye.
Causes Isaac's tears to be fired at a staggered rate.
The first shot after not firing for a while will always be a double shot.

neptunus.name: Neptunus
neptunus.description:
While not firing tears, Isaac charges a special attack that fires multiple tears in rapid succession.
The charge time and maximum tears per charge scales with Isaac's tears stat.
Has no effect on Isaac's tear rate when not charging.

voodoo head.name: Voodoo Head
voodoo head.description:
Spawns an additional Curse Room on each floor, whenever possible. Does not apply to the floor the item was picked up on.
Improves the layouts of Curse Rooms, often making them more beneficial.
Makes a penny spawn in every Curse Room.
Has no effect in Greed Mode.

act of contrition.name: Act of Contrition
act of contrition.description:
+1 Eternal Heart .
+0.7 tears.
+40% chance for a deal if Isaac has taken Red Heart damage. Additional +15% is added if the damage was taken against the boss.
Allows Angel Rooms to spawn even if a Devil Deal is/was taken.

battery pack.name: Battery Pack
battery pack.description:
Spawns 2-4 random batteries.
Fully charges Isaac's active item.

mom s bracelet.name: Mom's Bracelet
mom s bracelet.description:
Picks up the obstacle in front of Isaac, allowing him to carry it around the room, or even different rooms.
Pressing a fire button will launch the obstacle in the chosen direction. It will deal 40 damage to the enemy it hits, and break on impact. If it had any content inside it (e.g. a Tinted Rock), it will drop the contents normally.
Alternatively, the active item button can be pressed again to drop the object where Isaac is standing, without wasting the item's charge.
Can be used on Hosts to steal their skulls.
Can be used to pick up bombs, including Troll Bombs.
Can be used on friendly Dip familiars.
While carrying an obstacle, Isaac cannot travel to the next floor.
Throwing a Giant Poop at enemies will deal 320 damage.

member card.name: Member Card
member card.description:
Each shop will contain a trapdoor that leads to a special underground shop that sells 2-5 of the following:
• Trinket (15¢).
• Item (15-30¢). Items are chosen from the following item pools: Secret Room , Shop , Devil Room , Angel Room and Boss . Devil/Angel items can cost up to 50¢ while Secret Room items can go up to 99¢.
• Card/Rune/Soul Stone (6-8¢).
• Black Heart/Bone Heart (8¢).
• Eternal Heart (15¢).
• Rotten Heart (5¢).
The trapdoor will spawn even if Greed or Super Greed was fought in the shop.

the scooper.name: The Scooper
the scooper.description:
Summons The Peeper for the current room which also leaves a trail of red creep.
The Peeper deals 12 damage per tick (45 per second), while the creep deals 2 damage per tick (20 per second).
The Peeper can block enemy shots.
When active, Isaac gains +35% damage to tears shot from his right eye.

ocular rift.name: Ocular Rift
ocular rift.description:
Grants Isaac a 5% chance to fire a special tear that creates a rift where it lands, which damages nearby enemies and pulls in enemies, pickups and tears/enemy projectiles for 2 seconds.
Rifts deal 50% of Isaac's damage per tick (3x Isaac's damage per second).
Enemy projectiles pulled in by rifts will damage other enemies.
The size of the rift scales with Isaac's damage.
The chance to fire a rift is only slightly affected by luck.

boiled baby.name: Boiled Baby
boiled baby.description:
Spawns a familiar that follows Isaac and fires bursts of tears in all directions at random intervals while in a room with enemies.
The familiar shoots faster the closer it is to an enemy.
Each tear fired by the familiar does either 3.5 or 5.25 damage.

freezer baby.name: Freezer Baby
freezer baby.description:
Spawns a familiar that follows Isaac and shoots icicles which have a chance to petrify enemies and freeze them on kill.
Icicles deal 3.5 damage and are fired 1.36 times per second.
Frozen enemies obey the same rules as ice statues created by Uranus .

bird cage.name: Bird Cage
bird cage.description:
Spawns a familiar on top of Isaac's head that jumps onto the nearest enemy's head once Isaac takes damage, creating a rock wave in a random direction. After this, it will chase enemies around the room, dealing 3 damage per tick (6.43 per second).
The familiar deals 45 damage to the enemy it lands, and 10 damage per rock wave that hits enemies.
Rock waves can destroy obstacles.
If damage is taken in a room without enemies, the familiar will directly go to the flying phase.
Has a 1% chance of being dropped upon defeating The Cage.

eternal d6.name: Eternal D6
eternal d6.description:
Rerolls every item pedestal in the current room into another item from the current room's item pool, but has a 25% chance to delete the pedestal instead.
Once unlocked, the item can be acquired by killing Florian last when fighting Ultra Pride.
The chance to reroll items is not affected by luck.

lost soul.name: Lost Soul
lost soul.description:
Spawns a familiar that follows closely behind Isaac and dies in one hit, respawning at the start of the next floor.
If the familiar survives and is taken down to a new floor, it will rewards Isaac with one of the following:
• 3 Soul Hearts .
• 2 Eternal Hearts .
• 1 item from the Treasure Room or Angel Room item pool.
Has a 1% chance of being dropped upon defeating Blighted Ovum.

larynx.name: Larynx
larynx.description:
Isaac shouts, damaging and pushing away nearby enemies, and destroying obstacles and doors.
Can be used when the item is not fully charged, which affects the damage and range of the shout.
Damage of the shout is equal to 20 + 28 × ChargesUsed . Extra ticks of damage are dealt to enemies that are close enough: 2.5 + 3.5 × ChargesUsed .
The item gains 1 charge when Isaac takes damage.

blood bombs.name: Blood Bombs
blood bombs.description:
On pickup +1 full Red Heart container.
Heals 5 Red Heart containers.
While held Allows Isaac to place down bombs even when he doesn't have any, in exchange for half a heart of self-damage (prioritizes red hearts).
Causes Isaac's bombs to leave a pool of red creep on the ground upon exploding, that deals 2 damage per tick (20 per second) and lasts for 15 seconds.

lil dumpy.name: Lil Dumpy
lil dumpy.description:
Spawns a familiar that follows behind Isaac. When Isaac is about to take damage, the familiar farts and pushes away nearby enemies and projectiles. Enemies that collide with obstacles/walls, or other enemies, will take damage.
The fart will protect Isaac from the damage he's about to take, serving as a shield.
After farting, the familiar goes on cooldown until Isaac walks up to him, or enters a new room.
The familiar cannot prevent damage from environmental hazards.

lodestone.name: Lodestone
lodestone.description:
Grants Isaac a luck-based chance to fire tears that magnetize enemies, giving them properties similar to those of Strange Attractor .
Enemies, pickups, tears and enemy projectiles that are near magnetized enemies are pulled towards them.
Pulled enemy projectiles deal damage to enemies.
The chance to fire magnetizing tears scales with luck, using the formula 1 / (6 - LuckStat) ). It starts at 16.67% with 0 luck, going up to 100% with 5 luck.

bird s eye.name: Bird's Eye
bird s eye.description:
Grants Isaac a chance to shoot fires alongside his tears that block enemy shots and deal damage to enemies, similarly to Red Candle .
Fires can block up to 4 shots and/or deal 4 ticks of damage before being destroyed. They last for 10 seconds otherwise.
Fires deal 4x Isaac's damage at full durability, 3x after taking damage once, and 2x otherwise, for a maximum possible damage of 11x Isaac's damage per fire.
The chance to shoot a fire scales with Isaac's luck, and equals to 1 / (12 - LuckStat) . At base luck, the chance is 8.33%, going up to 50% with 10 luck.
Flames' size scales with Isaac's tear size.
Causes Isaac's farts to also spawn a fire.
Flames will turn certain enemies into stronger, fire-like variants.
Flames can be used to destroy Shopkeepers.
Has a 1% chance of being dropped upon defeating Singe.

rotten tomato.name: Rotten Tomato
rotten tomato.description:
Grants Isaac a luck-based chance to fire red tears that Mark enemies. Marked enemies move slower and are attacked by other enemies until killed, or the effect wears off.
The chance to fire Mark tears scales with luck, using the formula 1 / (6 - LuckStat) . It starts at 16.67% with 0 luck, going up to 100% with 5 luck.
While a Marked enemy is present in the room, other enemies ignore Isaac and attack that enemy instead.

birthright.name: Birthright
birthright.description:
Grants a passive ability that is unique for each character. This ability usually enhances the character's special traits or helps mitigate some of their downsides.
To check the effect given to each character, check the respective character's page.

red stew.name: Red Stew
red stew.description:
+21.6 temporary damage up.
Fully heals Isaac.
The damage boost scales down to 0 over the course of 3 minutes.
Isaac can extend the duration of the effect by killing enemies.
The effect disappears once the damage bonus goes down to 0.

booster pack.name: Booster Pack
booster pack.description: Spawns 5 random cards that have a high chance to be playing cards.

genesis.name: Genesis
genesis.description:
Resets all of Isaac's stats and transformations, removes the floor's curses, and removes all of Isaac's items, except his starting ones and those with the quest tag, and teleports him to a special Bedroom.
The Bedroom contains a Bed, 2 random Chests, 2 Grab Bags, a random trinket, and a beam of light that can be used to exit the room and go down to the next floor.
For every item removed by Genesis, a set of 3 choice-pedestals will spawn in the room containing items from the same item pool as the removed item. Only one of these items can be taken. Each set appears one after the other.
If used on a final floor of the game, the beam of light will be replaced with a Crawl Space that leads back to the starting room of the floor.
Trinkets that were absorbed will simply be removed from Isaac's inventory with no extra item pedestals granted for them.
Picking up an active item from the choice of items will not drop it on the ground, but instead replace it with the new item.
Genesis affects all players in the run.

sharp key.name: Sharp Key
sharp key.description:
On pickup +5 Keys.
On use Isaac holds a key above his head that can be launched by pressing a fire button, consuming a key from his inventory.
The key acts as a piercing projectile and deals damage to enemies equal to 5 × DamageStat + 30 .
The key will open any locked doors (including Secret Rooms) and chests it hits, as well as open up Key Blocks, but will break upon impact with one, or by hitting an obstacle.
Enemies killed by the key have a chance to spawn the contents of a chest.
Keys inherit Isaac's tear effects.

mega mush.name: Mega Mush
mega mush.description:
×4 damage multiplier.
+2 range.
-1.9 tears.
Turns Isaac into a invincible giant for 30 seconds, persisting between rooms and floors.
Isaac is able to destroy obstacles and doors by walking into them, as well as metal blocks. Cannot destroy doors that require a pickup in order to open.
Isaac deals massive amounts of rapid contact damage to enemies equal to 1 damage per tick (2400 per second).
Different types of weapons (e.g. Brimstone or Mom's Knife ) are overwritten while the effect is active. Isaac is only able to shoot regular tears.
Prevents Isaac from using donation mechanics such as Blood Donation Machines or Devil Beggars , since they will get destroyed on contact.

knife piece 2.name: Knife Piece 2
knife piece 2.description:
Can be acquired from the Mother chase scene in Mines/Ashpit II.
Spawns a knife blade familiar that follows Isaac.
When combined with the other piece, it forms a knife familiar that launches itself in the direction Isaac is shooting, dealing 25 damage to and piercing enemies it hits.
Can be launched at the red door at the end of Mausoleum/Gehenna to open the door leading to the Mother path, destroying the knife in the process.

knife piece 1.name: Knife Piece 1
knife piece 1.description:
Can be acquired from the Treasure Room in the Mirrored World in Downpour/Dross II.
Spawns a knife handle familiar that follows Isaac.
Makes a special room generate in the Mines/Ashpit II that contains Knife Piece 2 , the second piece of the knife.
When combined with the other piece, it forms a knife familiar that launches itself in the direction Isaac is shooting, dealing 25 damage to and piercing enemies it hits.
Can be launched at the red door at the end of Mausoleum/Gehenna to open the door leading to the Mother path, destroying the knife in the process.

death certificate.name: Death Certificate
death certificate.description:
Teleports Isaac to an abandoned and expanded version of the Home floor which contains a copy of every unlocked item in the game spread across different rooms.
After taking an item, Isaac returns to the room he used Death Certificate in.
The area often contains pickups and chests. Picking them up or acquiring items from the chests will not cause Isaac to leave the area.
Curse of the Blind! has no effect in the area.
Items in the area show up in the order from the lowest ID to the highest.
Modded items will also show up, expanding the area further.
Items that have the hidden tag and Dad's Note will not show up. Death Certificate itself cannot show up either.
Returning to the Death Certificate room on the same floor via another copy of the item or other means will result in an empty room.

bot fly.name: Bot Fly
bot fly.description:
Spawns a familiar that orbits Isaac, deals contact damage and fires shielded tears that destroy enemy projectiles.
The shielded tears home in on projectiles, but not enemies. They deal 3 damage if they hit an enemy.
The familiar deals 1 contact damage per tick (3.75 per second).
The familiar will instantly kill specific fly enemies upon contact.

meat cleaver.name: Meat Cleaver
meat cleaver.description:
Splits each enemy into two smaller versions that have ~40% health each.
Normal enemies can be split up to 2 times, while champions and bosses up to 3 times. Attempting to split over the maximum allowed amount deals 25 damage to enemies instead.
Some enemies, such as Mr. Maw that has a cable holding the two parts, will be detached instead.
Cannot split invincible enemies, including Hosts while lowered.
Final bosses cannot be split.
Delirium has no limit on how many times it can split.
Some bosses have special behavior when split:
• Gemini will separate both of its pieces.
• Loki turns into Lokii.
• Chub / C.H.A.D. / Carrion Queen will instantly die.
• Gabriel / Uriel will make each copy spawn a Key Piece.
• Horny Boys will turn into Loki and Hornfel.

evil charm.name: Evil Charm
evil charm.description:
+2 luck.
Makes Isaac immune to status effects, such as burning, confusion, fear, gas clouds, and Dogma's Godhead projectiles.
Grants immunity to contact damage to fire places, poison from destroying mushrooms, and any enemy flame attacks.
Allows Isaac to walk over cobwebs on the ground without them affecting his speed.
Allows Isaac to stand in damaging creep for 1 second before receiving any damage.

dogma.name: Dogma
dogma.description:
+2 damage.
Prevents speed from going under 1.1.
If Isaac has less than 6 hearts, gives enough hearts to get to 6 full hearts, first by restoring empty red heart containers, and then by granting soul hearts.
Grants a one-time-use Holy Mantle shield that wears off upon leaving the room.
Grants flight.
Grants The Wafer effect if playing on Normal Mode.
Automatically given to Isaac upon entering The Beast fight.

purgatory.name: Purgatory
purgatory.description:
Makes a red crack spawn on a random position in the room while inside a room with enemies. Walking over the crack summons a ghost that homes in on the nearest enemy and explodes.
A new crack will appear once a ghost is summoned.
The ghost explosion deals 2x Isaac's damage per tick, up to 4 times, and damages nearby enemies. It also destroys enemy projectiles.
The explosion cannot hurt Isaac or damage the environment.

stitches.name: Stitches
stitches.description:
On pickup Spawns a familiar that can be controlled with the firing buttons, that deals 1.5 damage per tick (3 per second).
On use Causes Isaac to swap places with the familiar, making him briefly invincible whilst teleporting.
Teleporting onto an enemy deals 3 × DamageStat + 40 damage to the enemy.
Teleporting onto a fire place will put it out, including fire places that require an explosion in order to destroy them.
The brief immunity can be used to enter Curse Rooms and open Spiked Chests for free.

r key.name: R Key
r key.description:
Restarts the run by returning Isaac to the beginning of Chapter 1, but without removing any items, pickups or consumables he has.
Angel Rooms become available again if a Devil Deal was previously taken.
The Donation Machine becomes unjammed if it was previously used or blown up.
Item and pill pools are not reset.
The in-game timer is not reset, meaning Boss Rush and Blue Womb requirements will not be reset either.

knockout drops.name: Knockout Drops
knockout drops.description:
Grants a luck-based chance to shoot red fist-shaped tears that deal huge knockback to enemies and confuse them for 2 seconds.
Enemies take 8 + 2 × CurrentFloor damage if they are knocked into a wall or an obstacle, or when hit by another knocked back enemy.
The chance to fire first tears scales with luck, starting at 10% with 0 luck, going up to 100% with 9 luck.

eraser.name: Eraser
eraser.description:
Makes Isaac hold the Eraser above his head that can be thrown with a shooting button in the desired direction.
Upon hitting an enemy, the type of enemy will be permanently erased and will no longer appear for the rest of the run. This is indicated by a pink puff appearing when such an enemy attempts to spawn.
If a boss is hit, it will instead deal 15 damage to him. If this damage is enough to kill it, the boss will be erased for the rest of the run.
Cannot be recharged normally. Only recharges automatically upon entering a new floor.

yuck heart.name: Yuck Heart
yuck heart.description:
+1 Rotten Heart .
Has a 1% chance of being dropped upon defeating Rotgut.

akeldama.name: Akeldama
akeldama.description:
Creates a trail of tears while in a room with enemies that Isaac drags behind him.
Each tear in the trail deals 3.5 damage.
The shorter the trail is, the faster it grows. The trail consists of 20 tears at its maximum length.
Clearing the room will stop the trail for regenerating.
Another trail of tears may appear if the trail is cut in the middle.
Has a 1% chance of being dropped upon defeating The Shell.

urn of souls.name: Urn of Souls
urn of souls.description:
Makes Isaac pull out (or put away) the Urn that, while out, can be fired by holding the shooting buttons in any direction.
The Urn shoots a constant stream of blue flames that deal 22.5-31.5 damage per second, depending on how far the flames have travelled, plus an additional 4.5 × CurrentFloor damage.
Isaac is pushed backwards while shooting the Urn.
The flames can destroy enemy projectiles and other fires, but will bounce off of rocks.
The Urn can only be recharged by picking up enemy souls that spawn when killing enemies. Up to 20 souls can be stored at once.
Bosses' souls grant a larger boost.
Each soul charge can shoot up to 15 flames over the course of half a second.

magic skin.name: Magic Skin
magic skin.description:
On use -1 Heart Container, Bone Heart or 2 Soul Hearts (chosen by priority as shown).
+1 Broken Heart which can never be filled, permanently reducing Isaac's maximum possible health.
Spawns an item from the current room's item pool.
Disappears after being used 12 times (or 18 times if playing as Magdalene with Birthright ).
The Lost and Tainted Lost can only use the item once before it disappears.
While held After using Magic Skin, if Isaac drops the item, any item that spawns in the future will have a chance to be replaced by Magic Skin.
The chance for this to happen is 33% after the first use, 50% after 2 uses, and 100% after 3 uses. This chance is drastically reduced if Magic Skin is on a pedestal somewhere on the current floor.
Has a 1% chance of being dropped upon defeating The Scourge.

revelation.name: Revelation
revelation.description:
Grants flight.
Whilst shooting, Isaac charges a special attack indicated by a charge bar that takes 2.35 seconds to fully charge. Releasing the fire button will shoot out a holy beam of light that deals Isaac's damage per tick up to 15 times.
The laser inherits some tear effects, such as homing.

tinytoma.name: Tinytoma
tinytoma.description:
Spawns a large familiar that slowly orbits around Isaac, and repels enemies that touch it, dealing 3.5 damage per tick (3.5 per second).
After blocking 3 shots and/or dealing 3 ticks of contact damage, the familiar splits into 2 smaller ones that orbit opposite of each other. They can only take 2 hits before being destroyed, and burst into 3 Blue Spiders in the process.
After both orbitals are destroyed, the familiar regenerates in its full size after 5 seconds.
Has a 1% chance of being dropped upon defeating Teratoma.

consolation prize.name: Consolation Prize
consolation prize.description:
Gives Isaac one of the following stat boosts based on which of his stats is the lowest:
• +1 flat damage.
• +0.5 fire rate.
• +0.2 speed.
• +2.5 range.
Also drops either 3 coins, 1 bomb, or 1 key, depending on what Isaac has the least of. For the purposes of this calculation, each key or bomb is equivalent to 3 coins.
If Isaac has the same amount of 2 lowest stats, one of them is selected randomly.
Having temporary stat boosts, such as those given by cards, will affect the payout given by the item.
A Soul Heart may be dropped as Bethany , or 2 Hearts as Tainted Bethany .
Poop Nuggets may be dropped as Tainted ??? . The game will check for his regular bomb count when doing this which which is always 0.

4 5 volt.name: 4.5 Volt
4 5 volt.description:
Prevents Isaac's active items from charging normally when clearing rooms.
Instead, active items are now charged when enemies take damage from any source.
Charges are gained at a rate of 40 + 20 × CurrentStage . For example, in Basement I it takes 60 damage to gain 1 charge, while in Home it takes 300 damage.
If an enemy receives more damage than their maximum amount of health, the excess amount will not be counted towards the recharge formula.

brimstone bombs.name: Brimstone Bombs
brimstone bombs.description:
+5 Bombs.
Makes Isaac's bombs fire 4 Brimstone lasers in the cardinal directions upon exploding.
Each laser deals 8 damage per tick (120 per second) and can hit enemies up to 19 times.
Has a 1% chance of being dropped upon defeating The Fallen.

fruity plum.name: Fruity Plum
fruity plum.description:
Spawns a familiar that mimics Baby Plum's attack of shooting tears and propelling itself diagonally around the room.
The familiar deals 2 damage per tick (8.57 per second). It fires 15 tears per second while moving which deal 3 damage each.
The familiar will prioritize moving towards nearby enemies.
If there are no enemies in the room, the familiar will loosely orbit Isaac.

star of bethlehem.name: Star of Bethlehem
star of bethlehem.description:
Spawns a glowing star that slowly travels towards the Boss Room using the shortest possible route.
The star is surrounded with a glowing aura that gives Isaac the following when standing inside it:
• ×1.2 damage multiplier.
• ×2.5 fire rate multiplier.
• Homing tears.
• 50% chance to block damage.
Once the star reaches the Boss Room, it will center itself in the room for the rest of the floor.
The speed of the star changes based on whether Isaac is in front or behind it in correlation to the Boss Room. It will speed up if it's lacking behind, or slow down if Isaac is behind.
The star may travel through Secret Rooms and Curse Rooms on its path to the Boss Room. It may also travel through Red Rooms if they create an optimal path to the Boss Room.
With Curse of the Labyrinth! active, the star will travel to the second Boss Room.
In the Void, the star will travel to Delirium's Boss Room.
In Greed Mode, the star will always center itself in the starting room, except on the final floor, where it will move to the Ultra Greed fight.
The star won't appear in The Beast fight.
If the Mega Satan door is opened, the star will travel to that fight instead.

plum flute.name: Plum Flute
plum flute.description:
Summons a friendly version of Baby Plum that fights for Isaac in the current room for 10 seconds.
The familiar will always twirl, jump, then spit blood and bounce around the room before flying away.
The familiar deals 12 contact damage per tick (36 per second), 5 when jumping in place, 3.5 per shot, 3-4 per shot while bouncing diagonally, and 2 damage per tick with creep (20 per second).
Can be obtained by using its unlock method.

false phd.name: False PHD
false phd.description:
On pickup +1 Black Heart.
While held Identifies all pills.
Converts all pills into their bad counterparts, but gives them positive secondary effects. Neutral pills don't gain a secondary effect.
Stat down pills will also grant +0.6 damage, or +1.2 if it was a horse pill.
Other bad pills will drop a Black Heart .
The item's effects work retroactively, giving stat boosts for each stat down pill taken before picking up the item.
When combined with PHD or other items that convert pills, the effects neutralize themselves allowing both types of pills to exist again.

vade retro.name: Vade Retro
vade retro.description:
While held Enemies leave behind small, red ghosts upon death.
On use Causes all red ghosts to explode, dealing damage to nearby enemies and destroying projectiles.
The explosion cannot hurt Isaac or damage the environment.
The explosion deals damage equal to 3 + 0.04 × EnemyMaxHealth + (CurrentFloor - 1) × 0.5 . Each explosion can hit the same enemy up to 4 times.
The blast radius scales with how powerful the explosion is.
Instantly kills any enemy that has the "ghost" tag and is at 50% or less HP, including bosses. This can even be used to kill Delirium if it transforms into such an enemy. Enemies that are currently not visible on screen are not detonated.
Detonates Isaac's ghost after his death, dealing 200 damage to nearby enemies.
Ghosts can be slightly pushed around by shooting at them.

cube baby.name: Cube Baby
cube baby.description:
Spawns a frozen ice cube familiar that cannot move on its own, and requires Isaac to kick it, causing it to slide around the room and deal contact damage to enemies.
The cube can be kicked by walking into it, melee attacked, or be shot at. It can also be picked up by using Mom's Bracelet .
The familiar deals up to 11 contact damage based on how fast it's traveling, 4.29 times per second.
The familiar will slow enemies it touches while moving.
Enemies killed by the familiar are frozen, and obey the same rules as ice statues created by Uranus .
The familiar blocks enemy projectiles.

spin to win.name: Spin to Win
spin to win.description:
While held Spawns a spinning wheel familiar that orbits Isaac, blocks enemy shots and deals 3.5 damage per tick (26.25 per second).
On use Holding the active item button makes the wheel spin rapidly around Isaac, giving him +0.5 speed, and increasing the contact damage of all of Isaac's familiars, even if they normally don't do any.
Orbital familiars also spin much faster and knock back both enemies and Isaac while dealing damage.
The contact damage is boosted to 1.5 × ContactDamage + 6 . If a familiar does not do contact damage normally, it still received the +6.
This means that Spin to Win deals 11.25 damage per tick (84.38 per second) while spinning.
Also affects Blue Flies and Blue Spiders, and they don't die while the item is in use.
The recharge time is gradually drained over 3 seconds while the item is being used. It can be used even when the charge bar is not full.
Isaac's effective speed can exceed the 2.0 limit, even if the HUD doesn't show it.

giant cell.name: Giant Cell
giant cell.description:
Taking damage summons a miniature Isaac familiar known as Minisaac, that chases enemies and fires tears on its own.
Minisaacs' tear damage is based on the formula: 1.20 + 0.15 × CurrentFloor .
The familiar shoots 3 times per second.
Minisaacs persist between rooms and floors.
Each Minisaac starts with 15 health points that are constantly drained with a rate of 0.4 per second, until it reaches 0.8 HP.
Whenever Isaac takes damage, all Minisaacs are healed back to their full health.
Minisaacs take damage from enemy projectiles and contact damage. They can also be damaged by Isaac's bombs.
Minisaacs are immune to spikes and lasers.
No more than 16 Minisaacs can exist at a time.
When playing as The Forgotten , a special Minisaac variant will spawn that inherits the bone club attack. This familiar deals 8.1 + 0.9 × CurrentFloor damage, and swings its bone club 1.5 times per second.
Minisaacs receive wings if Isaac has any form of flight.
Has a 1% chance of being dropped upon defeating Polycephalus.

card reading.name: Card Reading
card reading.description:
Creates 2 portals at the beginning of each floor. They can spawn at random with different colors, each taking Isaac to a different room:
• Red: Boss Room.
• Yellow: Treasure Room.
• Blue: Secret Room.
• Green: Shop.
The portals disappear once the starting room is left.
From Chapter 4 onward, only 1 portal will spawn.

vasculitis.name: Vasculitis
vasculitis.description:
Makes enemies release 1-16 friendly tears in random directions upon death. Tears appear as large red blood clots which may make them hard to distinguish from enemy projectiles. They also inherit Isaac's tear effects thus may appear in a different color.
The amount of tears released is based on the enemy's max health points.
Burst tears deal a set amount of damage: 3.2 + 0.3 × CurrentStage .
If an enemy is killed while affected by a status effect, the burst tears will inherit that status effect.

quints.name: Quints
quints.description:
Spawns a stationary familiar in the place of killed enemies, up to 5 per room. Familiars appear colorless.
The following familiars can be spawned:
• Abel 
• Boiled Baby 
• Brother Bobby 
• Demon Baby 
• Freezer Baby 
• Ghost Baby 
• Guardian Angel 
• Harlequin Baby 
• Lil Brimstone 
• Little Steven 
• Multidimensional Baby 
• Robo-Baby 
• Rotten Baby 
• Seraphim 
• Sister Maggy 
The same type of familiar can spawn multiple times per room.

tooth and nail.name: Tooth and Nail
tooth and nail.description:
Causes Isaac to turn to stone and sprout spikes every 6 seconds. Isaac is immune to damage while in this state, and deals 40 damage per tick (80 per second). The effect lasts for 1 second.
Isaac will flash white 4 times before turning into stone on the 4th flash. These flashes are accompanied with a ticking sound.
Can be used to enter Curse Rooms and open Spiked Chests for free, but cannot be used to play Blood Donation Machines and Devil Beggars for free.
Has a 1% chance of being dropped upon defeating Tuff Twins.

guppy s eye.name: Guppy's Eye
guppy s eye.description:
Shows the contents of Chests, Fire Places, Grab Bags and Shopkeepers before they're opened/destroyed.
Up to 4 contents can be displayed at a time, with higher-quality pickups like Bombs, Keys and Soul Hearts having priority on the display.

binge eater.name: Binge Eater
binge eater.description:
On pickup +1 full Red Heart container.
Fully heals Isaac.
While held Causes item pedestals to have an additional food item which cycles alongside the original item.
Picking up the food item grants Isaac with the following: 
• +3.6 damage which fades over 30 seconds. This boost cannot be stacked and will be reset to 3.6 by picking up additional food items.
• 0.03 speed.
• A permanent boost to 2 stats depending on the food item consumed.
• +1 additional red heart heal.
Stat boosts are different based on the item consumed:
• Breakfast : +0.2 shot speed, +2.5 range.
• Dessert : +1 flat damage, +0.2 shot speed.
• Dinner : +0.5 tears, +0.2 shot speed.
• Lunch : +0.5 tears, +2.5 range.
• Midnight Snack : +1 flat damage, +1 luck.
• Rotten Meat : +1 flat damage, +2.5 range.
• A Snack : +0.2 shot speed, +1 luck.
• Supper : +0.5 tears, +1 luck.
Stat boosts also work retroactively, meaning that picking up Binge Eater will grant all relevant stat boosts from food items previously collected, excluding the additional healing provided by them.
Certain item pedestals that are required to progress the game won't gain the additional food item.

strawman.name: Strawman
strawman.description:
+1 Bomb.
Spawns Keeper as an extra controllable character alongside Isaac. The familiar will receive the same inputs as Isaac, but can be separated by holding down the "drop" button.
The Keeper will have his base stats, except speed which is shared between both characters. He won't receive any of his starting items.
The Keeper is able to pick up items on his own, thus having a separate inventory. He is not able, however, to pick up active items, trinkets, or consumables.
The Keeper's health is displayed over his head, and he can heal normally by picking up coins. Curse of the Unknown will hide his health bar.
Devil Room items will cost money instead of health while The Keeper is alive.
Placing a bomb will also make The Keeper place a bomb free of charge.
The Keeper is not able to walk through doors on his own, but he can enter the beams of light and the ending chest.
Unlocks for The Keeper cannot be earned by using this item.
When The Keeper dies, he spawns 5 Blue Spiders and the item is removed from Isaac's inventory. None of the items collected by The Keeper are dropped.

dad s note.name: Dad's Note
dad s note.description:
Initiates the Ascent sequence, teleporting Isaac to the backward floors, ultimately leading to the Home floor and The Beast fight.
The item cannot be rerolled or destroyed.
Can be acquired by entering the Strange Door that appears in the beginning of Depths II by using The Polaroid or The Negative on it. This will take Isaac to the Mausoleum/Gehenna, where the Boss Room will contain the item.
Has no effect if obtained outside the special Boss Room, except for the music slowly fading out.

sausage.name: Sausage
sausage.description:
+1 full Red Heart container.
+0.2 speed.
+0.5 damage.
+0.5 tears.
+2.5 range.
+0.2 shot speed.
+1 luck.
+6.9% for a Devil/Angel Room.
+6.9% Planetarium chance.
Fully heals Isaac.

a pound of flesh.name: A Pound of Flesh
a pound of flesh.description:
Items that require health to purchase now require money instead, and vice-versa.
Consumables in Shops no longer have a cost, but are instead surrounded by spikes that deal a full heart of damage. The pickups inside the spikes cannot be pushed by an explosion.
Buying Shop items for health does not prevent Angel Rooms from appearing.
Immunity from spikes does not prevent damage from the special spikes inside Shops. Invincibility frames or invulnerability from certain items will disallow Isaac from taking the pickups.

candy heart.name: Candy Heart
candy heart.description:
On pickup Spawns a Heart .
While held Gives Isaac one of the following stat boost per half heart healed by picking up Red Hearts or Rotten Hearts :
• +0.02 speed.
• +0.05 tears.
• +0.10 flat damage.
• +0.25 range.
• +0.02 shot speed.
• +0.10 luck.
Items that heal Isaac won't grant any boosts. Only hearts picked up off the ground count.
Does not work when adding to Tainted Bethany 's blood charges.

options question.name: Options?
options question.description:
Makes 2 room clear rewards spawn instead of 1, but only one of them can be taken, while the other one disappears.
If one of the rewards is a Troll Bomb, picking up the other reward will not make the Troll Bomb disappear.

redemption.name: Redemption
redemption.description:
Makes a white inverted cross appear over Isaac's head upon entering a Devil Room. If Isaac goes to the next floor with the cross active, he will gain +1 Soul Heart and +1 damage.
Taking anything generated by the Devil Room will result in the icon going away. This includes both items, chests and pickups.
It is safe to pick up stuff that have been spawned after room generation, e.g. enemy drops or room clear rewards.
If a Red Chest generates an item, the item can be taken without the cross disappearing.
The item can be acquired from a Confessional or a Sacrifice Room after a devil deal has been taken.

spirit shackles.name: Spirit Shackles
spirit shackles.description:
Upon death, Isaac turns into a ghost linked to Isaac's dead body, and can continue fighting with 1/2 of a heart for 10 seconds, after which he comes back to life.
Isaac gains flight while in ghost form.
The effect cannot occur again until a half or full Soul Heart or Black Heart is picked up. Doing so will charge the item without adding to Isaac's health.
The Shackles appear blue when ready to be used, and grey when they aren't.

cracked orb.name: Cracked Orb
cracked orb.description:
Taking damage activates the following effects:
• Unlocks all locked doors in the room. It can even unlock the Mega Satan door and the Strange Door in Depths II.
• Opens the Secret Room and Super Secret Room if adjacent to the current room.
• Reveals a random unmapped room on the floor. It can also reveal the Ultra Secret Room.
• Destroys all Tinted Rocks and rocks with a Crawl Space.
Cannot open Challenge Rooms from the outside, and regular rooms in the Chest or Dark Room.
Cannot open the door leading to Boss Rush or Blue Womb.

empty heart.name: Empty Heart
empty heart.description:
Adds an empty heart container at the beginning of each floor if Isaac has one red heart or less.
Does nothing with characters that cannot have red hearts.
Has a 1% chance of being dropped upon defeating The Visage.

c section.name: C Section
c section.description:
Replaces Isaac's tears with a short-delay charge attack that fires homing, piercing, spectral fetus-like tears. The charge attack fires on its own after fully charged.
Fetus tears do 75% of Isaac's damage, 3.75 times per second, until they run out of range.
Charge time depends on Isaac's fire rate: 30 / (RoundUp(TearDelay × 3) + 1) . This cannot exceed 15.
The size of the fetuses scales with Isaac's damage.
Fetuses inherit Isaac's tear effects, and some special weapon effects, such as Mom's Knife or The Forgotten 's bone club.

astral projection.name: Astral Projection
astral projection.description:
Taking damage for the first time in an uncleared room will stop time for 2 seconds, and turn Isaac into a ghost, leaving his body behind.
While in ghost form, Isaac gains flight, spectral tears, increased speed, and can shoot at a very fast rate, despite this not being shown on the HUD, as it's a result of time being slowed down.
Isaac will re-enter the body when the room is cleared, or if he takes damage, which will negate the damage.
Has a 1% chance of being dropped upon defeating Clutch.

lil abaddon.name: Lil Abaddon
lil abaddon.description:
Spawns a familiar that follows Isaac and creates a black ring after charging for 1 second.
The ring deals 3.5 damage per tick (52.5 per second), and lasts for 1 second.

montezuma s revenge.name: Montezuma's Revenge
montezuma s revenge.description:
Continuously shooting for 2.35 seconds allows Isaac to fire a short-range brown Brimstone laser and corn shots behind him.
The laser deals Isaac's damage per tick, 15 times per second, and lasts for ~1.28 seconds.
Corn shots deal 6 damage, and a random amount of them are created with each blast.
Has a 1% chance of being dropped upon defeating Dangle.

lil portal.name: Lil Portal
lil portal.description:
Spawns a familiar that follows Isaac and can be launched by double-tapping a shooting key.
The familiar will consume pickups and trinkets in its path, converting them into Blue Flies while increasing its size.
Upon consuming 1 + 1 × CurrentFloor pickups, it will spawn a purple portal that leads to a special room. The contents of this room remain unchanged for the duration of the run, and it may be accessed from any floor by creating the portal again.
The portal remains in the same place it was initially created, even after Isaac leaves the room. Its location will be marked on the map.
After creating a portal, the familiar disappears until the next floor, where another portal can be created that leads back to the same room.
Damage dealt by the familiar is equal to 2 + 2 × ConsumablesDestroyed + 2 per tick, ticking up to 10 times per second. This damage cannot exceed 6.
The familiar does not deal damage or consume pickups while following behind Isaac. It must be launched in order to do so.
Any trapdoors created in the portal room will lead to the I AM ERROR room.

worm friend.name: Worm Friend
worm friend.description:
Spawns a familiar that burrows out of the ground and grabs enemies every 5 seconds, holding them in place for 5 seconds.
Grabbed enemies take 4 damage per tick (8 per second).
Also applies slowness on grabbed enemies, which affects their shots as well.
Has a 1% chance of being dropped upon defeating The Stain.

bone spurs.name: Bone Spurs
bone spurs.description:
Enemies spawn 1-2 floating bones upon death, which block enemy shots and damage/repel enemies that touch them.
Bones can block up to 2 shots and/or deal 2 ticks of damage before breaking.
Bones deal damage equal to Isaac's damage in the moment they were created.
Has a 1% chance of being dropped upon defeating Carrion Queen.

jar of wisps.name: Jar of Wisps
jar of wisps.description:
Spawns wisps that orbit Isaac, fire tears, block enemy shots, and deal contact damage to enemies, much like the ones spawned by Book of Virtues .
The Jar will initially spawn 2 wisps, but the amount is increased by +1 each time the jar is used, up to a total of 12 wisps. The amount of wisps the jar will spawn is indicated by both a counter and the jar visually filling up with wisps.
Every wisp spawned has a 15% chance of being of a special variant.

hungry soul.name: Hungry Soul
hungry soul.description:
Grants enemies a 33% chance to spawn a friendly red ghost upon death, which chases down enemies and deals contact damage to them.
Ghosts deal damage equal to 50% of Isaac's damage (2x Isaac's damage per second).
The ghost explodes after 7 seconds, dealing 7 damage to nearby enemies up to 3-4 times. This explosion cannot damage Isaac or the environment.
Enemies killed by ghosts won't spawn additional ghosts, except for those killed by the ghost's explosion.

friend finder.name: Friend Finder
friend finder.description:
Spawns a random friendly monster that mimics Isaac's movement and attacks.
Can spawn the following monsters:
• Black Bony.
• Blaster.
• Bony.
• Chubber.
• Clot.
• Clotty.
• Coal Boy.
• Danny.
• Dople.
• Double Vis.
• Drowned Hive.
• Evil Twin.
• Grilled Clotty.
• Gurgle.
• Hive.
• Holy Bony.
• Holy Mulligan.
• I.Blob.
• Maw.
• Nest.
• Vis.
Certain enemies will have a crosshair that indicates where they're shooting.
Blasters will only fire by pressing the active item button.

soul locket.name: Soul Locket
soul locket.description:
On pickup Spawns a Soul Heart .
While held Gives Isaac one of the following stat boosts per half heart gained by picking up Soul Heart or Black Hearts off the ground:
• +0.04 speed.
• +0.1 tears.
• +0.2 flat damage.
• +0.5 range.
• +0.04 shot speed.
• +0.20 luck.

inner child.name: Inner Child
inner child.description:
+1 Extra Life.
Upon death, Isaac respawns in the current room with half a red heart (or half soul heart if he doesn't have any red heart containers), and receives:
+0.2 speed.
-50% size.
-73% hitbox size.
Respawning as the inner child emits a blood explosion that deals 35 damage to nearby enemies.
After unlocking, the item is guaranteed to spawn in the hidden closet in the Home floor once the tainted version of the current character has been unlocked.

glitched crown.name: Glitched Crown
glitched crown.description:
Causes newly generated item pedestals to indefinitely cycle between 5 random items from the current room's item pool, at a very quick rate of once every 0.2 seconds.
Does not affect quest items.
Also affects items during Curse of the Blind! , but none of the items can be seen.
Pausing the game will cause the items to cycle much faster. This does not apply to the pause caused by the Debug Console.

sacred orb.name: Sacred Orb
sacred orb.description:
Decreases the chances of low-quality items appearing by affecting newly created pedestals in the following way:
• Rerolls items with quality 0-1.
• Has a 33% chance to reroll items with quality 2.
Items with the quest tag cannot be rerolled.

belly jelly.name: Belly Jelly
belly jelly.description:
Enemies and projectiles that touch Isaac have a 50% chance to bounce off of him and propel in the opposite direction. When this happens, damage to Isaac is negated.
Bounced off enemies will take damage upon hitting a wall or an obstacle, or another enemy. The damage is equal to 8 + 2 × CurrentFloor .
