Only enemies that normally deal contact damage can be bounced off.
Bounced off projectiles deal 6 damage if they would deal half a heart of damage, or 7 if they would deal a full heart.
Lasers cannot be bounced off.
The bouncing mechanic also works for Fire Places and spikes enemies such as Poky, Slide and Grudge, granting a chance to avoid unintentional damage.

the swarm.name: The Swarm
the swarm.description:
On pickup Spawns 8 orbital flies.
While held Each time one of the flies blocks a projectile, it will turn into a Blue Fly.
An additional orbital fly is spawned upon clearing a room, up to a maximum of 16 at a time.

sanguine bond.name: Sanguine Bond
sanguine bond.description:
Spawns a special set of spikes in every Devil Room that deal a full heart of damage per use. Taking damage from the spikes has a chance to yield a reward:
• 35% - nothing.
• 33% - +0.5 damage.
• 15% - 6 pennies .
• 10% - 2 Black Hearts .
• 5% - random item from the Devil Room pool.
• 2% - Leviathan transformation.
The spikes will deal damage to enemies that walk or fly over them.
Causes all other spikes in the Devil Room to retract.

heartbreak.name: Heartbreak
heartbreak.description:
+3 Broken Hearts.
+0.25 damage for every Broken Heart Isaac has.
Causes every fatal hit to add 2 more Broken Hearts instead of killing Isaac, and deal 40 damage to all enemies in the room.
This effect won't prevent death from Devil Deals.

bloody gust.name: Bloody Gust
bloody gust.description:
When Isaac takes damage, he gains stat boosts for the rest of the floor, up to a maximum of 6 times per floor:
• +0.04 × HitsTaken + 0.07 speed
• +0.1 × HitsTaken + 0.25 fire rate

vanishing twin.name: Vanishing Twin
vanishing twin.description:
Spawns a fetus familiar that follows Isaac.
After entering a Boss Room, the familiar will move to the center of the room, and transform into a clone of the boss. Isaac must defeat both bosses in order to proceed.
When this happens, both the original boss and its copy will be set to 75% of their maximum health, and will gain slightly reduced movement and attack speed.
Upon dying, the clone will drop an item from the Boss item pool, even before the fight is over. The original boss will also grant another item.
The cloning can happen only once per floor.
The familiar cannot clone mini-bosses and final bosses such as Mom, Mom's Heart, Isaac, Satan, etc.
The familiar can clone the boss even after it's been defeated.
On floors with multiple boss rooms, the familiar will act only on the first boss encountered.
If it clones Great Gideon, 2 extra waves of enemies are added to the battle.
The item is removed from item pools and cannot be found normally starting from Chapter 4.
The item has no effect in Greed Mode.

salvation.name: Salvation
salvation.description:
Creates an angelic halo around Isaac that, when an enemy comes in contact with, a beam of light starts forming above them. If they stay in the halo for about a second, a beam of light will strike down on them, dealing damage to them and creating 4 more beams in the cardinal directions.
The initial beam does 3.5 damage per tick, up to 15 times, and the others deal 1.75 per second, up to 15 times.
The halo will grow in size each time Isaac takes damage, up to a maximum of 10 times. The size resets after leaving the floor.

twisted pair.name: Twisted Pair
twisted pair.description:
Spawns 2 familiars that float by the left and right side of Isaac, and fire tears alongside him that copy his stats and tear effects.
Each familiar deals 37.5% of Isaac's damage. When playing as Lilith or Tainted Lilith , they instead deal 50% damage each.

azazel s rage.name: Azazel's Rage
azazel s rage.description:
Upon clearing a room, Isaac builds up rage that is indicated by the patch of skin spreading around his face, as well as 4 sections of the horn lighting up red one at a time.
After clearing 4 rooms, Isaac's head will flash red. Upon entering room with enemies, a large Brimstone laser is fired for ~3.33 seconds, that deals Isaac's damage per tick, 15 times per second.

echo chamber.name: Echo Chamber
echo chamber.description:
When Isaac uses a consumable (card, pill, rune, soul stone, etc), he also uses a copy of the 3 previous consumables used after picking up Echo Chamber.
Consumables used with mimic items, such as Blank Card , Placebo or Clear Rune , won't get added to the queue.

isaac s tomb.name: Isaac's Tomb
isaac s tomb.description:
Makes an Old Chest appear at the start of each floor.
The chest won't spawn on the Home floor.

vengeful spirit.name: Vengeful Spirit
vengeful spirit.description:
Upon taking damage, spawns an invulnerable red wisp that fires spectral tears and deals contact damage, but does not block projectiles.
Wisps are destroyed when leaving the floor. Up to 6 wisps can be created per floor.
Wisps' tears are shot once per second, and deal damage equal to 2.9 + 0.1 × CurrentFloor .
Contact damage is equal to 50% of Isaac's damage per tick, and is dealt 15 times per second.

esau jr.name: Esau Jr.
esau jr.description:
Swaps between the current character and Esau Jr., a separate character that has 3 Black Hearts, +2 flat damage, and flight.
Coins, bombs, and keys are shared between the 2 characters, but a separate inventory exists for everything else (health, items, consumables, trinkets).
When used for the first time, Esau Jr. receives random items equal to the number of items the original characters has. Each item is chosen from the same item pool as the original item. Only passive items are given substitutes. Items with the quest tag and set drops (such as The Small Rock ) are not counted and won't get a substitute item.
If either character dies, they will both die.
Esau Jr. will receive any passive starting item the original character had, however, if said items are rerollable, they will count towards the number of items he should get, resulting in both the staring item and 1 extra to be obtained.
Using 5 different copies of Esau Jr. one after the other, starting from the 5th copy, Esau Jr.'s jar will break and create a familiar that behaves like Abel , and deals 7.5 damage per shot but at a faster fire rate.

berserk.name: Berserk!
berserk.description:
+0.4 speed.
+3 flat damage.
+2 fire rate.
×0.5 fire rate multiplier.
Replaces Isaac's tears with a jaw bone similar to The Forgotten 's club. It also uses the same synergies as the club.
This effect lasts for 5 seconds.
The jaw bone deals 3x Isaac's damage when swung, and 1.5x Isaac's damage when thrown.
Swinging the jaw bone will reflect enemy shots, and is able to pick up pickups from a distance.
Killing an enemy while in Berserk mode will increase the duration of the effect by 1 second, and grant very brief invincibility that prevents damage from exploding enemies. Duration cannot be increased by more than 5 seconds.
Each enemy killed will also grant +0.4 speed until the effect ends.
Isaac is unable to die while in Berserk mode. His health can go down to 0, but he will not die until the effect ends. During this time, he can heal himself and cheat death.
The item starts at 50% charge when picked up. It is charged by dealing damage to enemies instead of clearing rooms or picking up batteries. To fully charge it, Isaac must deal damage equal to 120 + 40 × CurrentFloor .

dark arts.name: Dark Arts
dark arts.description:
+1 speed.
Allows Isaac to walk through enemies/bullets for 1 second, or until he shoots. Walking through them will freeze them until the effect ends, then deal damage to them equal to 2 × DamageStat + 3.5 . If multiple enemies/projectiles get caught in the attack, each consecutive attack deals an additional 3.5 damage.
At the end of the effect, an area of blast is created, dealing more damage the more enemies or projectiles were pierced during the effect.
When used as Black Judas or Tainted Judas , they will gain a temporary +1 damage bonus for every enemy/projectile walked through, that wears off at a rate of -0.25 every half a second.
During the effect, Isaac is unable to collect pickups or use machines/beggars.
The effect can be used to walk freely through Curse Rooms and walk over spikes, or open Spiked Chests.
Invulnerable enemies will still grant bonuses even if they cannot be damaged.

abyss.name: Abyss
abyss.description:
Consumes all item pedestals in the room and gives a unique red locust familiar for each item consumed.
The locusts are permanent once created, and up to 64 can exists at a time. Consuming more items after this number will replace older locusts. This limit is shared with Blue Flies and Blue Spiders.
The locusts loosely follow Isaac similarly to Blue Flies, and charge in the direction he's firing until they hit an enemy, wall, or obstacle.
Locusts deal various damage 4.29 times per second, based on the consumed item's quality, and have a different size multiplier:
• Quality 0: 0.5x Isaac's damage, 0.8x size.
• Quality 1: 0.75x Isaac's damage, 0.9x size.
• Quality 2: 1x Isaac's damage, 1x size.
• Quality 3: 1.5x Isaac's damage, 1.1x size.
• Quality 4: 2x Isaac's damage, 1.2x size.
Some items, when consumed, will produce a unique locust with different behavior. Check the respective item pages to see if Abyss would create such a locust.
If at the limit of 64 locusts and multiple item pedestals are present in the room, Abyss will only consume half of the items.
Items can be consumed while the pick-up animation is playing, i.e. Isaac is holding the item above his head.
Absorbing items counts as Isaac taking them, thus will activate Boss Rush, Challenge Rooms, and similar mechanics.
If Abyss is used in a room with linked choice item pedestals, only one of them will be absorbed, while the others will vanish as if Isaac took them.

supper.name: Supper
supper.description:
+1 full Red Heart container.
Heals 1 additional Red Heart.

suplex.name: Suplex!
suplex.description:
Causes Isaac to dash a short distance. If he runs into an enemy while dashing, he will pick them up and a crosshair spawns under him that can be controlled with the shooting buttons.
After 1 second, Isaac leaps up and slams down on the crosshair with the enemy, dealing damage to them and any enemies he lands on. This also creates a circular wave of rocks that damages nearby enemies and destroys projectiles.
Isaac is invulnerable while dashing and holding an enemy, except to damage from Blood Donation Machines and Devil Beggars .
The damage of the slam is equal to 50 ± S , where S is the number of size ups/downs Isaac has.
Each spike in the rock wave deals 10 damage, and the range of the wave scales with Isaac's size.
Isaac can also Suplex bombs, bosses, shopkeepers, TNT, stone enemies, fire places, furniture in the Home level, etc.

stapler.name: Stapler
stapler.description:
+1 damage.
Prevents Isaac from firing tears from his left eye.

bag of crafting.name: Bag of Crafting
bag of crafting.description:
Upon use, pressing an attack button will cause a swipe attack that deals 3 damage to enemies and knocks them back. The size of the swipe scales with Isaac's size, and is affected by his range.
The swipe can be used to open chests and block projectiles.
Swiping a pickup off the floor will add it to the bag. Up to 8 pickups can be stored in the bag. These pickups cannot be dropped.
Double pickups will add 2 copies of the pickup into the bag.
Pickups can also be collected from the Shop, if Isaac has enough money to buy them first.
Once 8 pickups have been collected, the bag can be used once more to create an item based on the types of pickups (components) collected.
A random recipe is chosen for each item when the run starts. This is seeded per run.
If the bag would grant an item that hasn't been unlocked yet, a random item will be crafted instead.
Some recipes are fixed and exist in every run. Check the GuruWiki page for a full list of fixed recipes.
The crafted item is chosen from one of the following pools:
• 40% → Boss 
• 40% → Shop 
• 20% → Treasure Room 
Pickups added into the bag have different qualities. Some pickups grant a chance to craft an item from a different pool. Check the GuruWiki page for more details.
Based on the overall quality of all components in the bag, the crafted item can be chosen from a special pool ( Angel Room , Devil Room , or Secret Room ), or other pools based on previously explained criteria.
The overall quality of components in the bag also affects the crafted item's possible quality.
Special pool 
Other pool 
Item quality 
40+ 
35+ 
4 
32-39 
27-34 
3-4 
28-31 
23-26 
2-4 
24-27 
19-22 
2-3 
20-23 
15-18 
1-2 
14-19 
9-14 
0-2 
0-13 
0-8 
0-1 
When playing as Tainted Cain 
The item that would be crafted is displayed in the bottom-right corner of the screen.
Getting more than 8 pickups in the bag will shift its contents left and up, deleting the top-left slot and adding to the bottom-right.
Tapping the drop key will cycle the bag's contents left and up in a loop. Holding the use button will craft the displayed item.
Crafting an active item while already holding one will turn the old one into pickups, just like collecting it would.
Curse of the Blind! will hide the crafting preview.

sumptorium.name: Sumptorium
sumptorium.description:
When used by any character other than Tainted Eve 
Removes half a heart of health and creates a blood clot familiar.
Blood clots mimic Isaac's movement, shooting, and inherit tear, effect, including weapon effects.
Holding down the drop button allows Isaac to move independently from the clots.
The familiar start with 15 HP that slowly decays down to 1 HP over time, or 5 HP for clots created by non-red hearts.
Clots are immune to hazards such as spikes, fire places, and lasers.
Enemies deal 1 point of contact and projectile damage when they hit them.
Isaac's bombs and Troll Bombs deal 2 points of damage.
Each type of heart generates a unique type of blood clot, however red hearts are prioritized when using the item:
• Red Heart: 35% damage.
• Soul Heart: 35% damage; 22.5 HP.
• Black Heart: 43% damage; Dark Matter tears.
• Eternal Heart: 52% damage; Sacred Heart tears.
• Golden Heart: 35% damage; Midas' Touch tears (scales with luck).
• Bone Heart: 35% damage; Compound Fracture tears.
• Rotten Heart: 35% damage; 7.5 HP.
When playing as Tainted Eve 
Holding down the fire button will create blood clot familiars every 2 seconds and drain half a heart.
Activating the item will recall all previously created blood clots and heal Tainted Eve for the same type of hearts used to generate the clots.
Blood clots deal 3x Tainted Eve's damage to enemies they pass through when returned to her.
If more blood clots get returned that the amount of health she can have, excess blood clots will drop next to her.
The item has a recharge time of 1 second instead of 10.
A maximum of 29 clots can be absorbed at once.

flip.name: Flip
flip.description:
While held When Isaac enters a room containing an item, the item pedestal will appear with a secondary ghostly item behind it.
Only the real item can be interacted with. The ghostly one will vanish if Isaac leaves the room and there is no real item on the pedestal.
Item pedestals that are spawned after room generation, e.g. Boss Room items, items from chests, etc., won't have a ghostly item.
Buying an item from a Shop or Devil Deal will also buy the ghostly version of it for free.
On use Cycles between the real and ghostly items on pedestals, allowing Isaac to collect the ghostly variant.
Does not affect pedestals that don't have a ghostly item on them.
If playing as Tainted Lazarus , it will switch between the dead and alive form of the character, and the item will have only 4 charges rather than 6.

lemegeton.name: Lemegeton
lemegeton.description:
Grants an orbital wisp that takes the form of a random passive item.
The summoned item will act as if Isaac owns it, but is active only while the wisp is alive.
The item has a 25% chance to be chosen from the current room's item pool, otherwise a random pool is selected.
Only items with the summonable tag can be generated.
The wisps can block up to 4 shots and/or get hit by 2 explosions before destroyed.
Wisps deals contact damage equal to 2x Isaac's damage per tick, 2 times per second. They also receive contact damage.
A total of 24 wisps can be created. Using the item when this limit is reached will replace the oldest wisp.
Item wisps do not exhaust item pools, meaning Isaac can still normally find these items in a run, and multiple of the same item wisp can be obtained.
Wisps do not contribute towards transformations, or the Collection Page.
Items that would normally grant pickups or health, will not do so when summoned as wisps.

recall.name: Recall
recall.description:
Only has an effect when playing as Tainted Forgotten , and can only be obtained via his Birthright .
Retreives The Forgotten's body automatically, even from a distance.
Tainted Soul is invincible while the body is returning to him, except to forms of self-damage such as Devil Beggars .
Tainted Forgotten will deal ~4-6x Isaac's damage to enemies that collide with it while it's returning to the Soul.
The item cannot be used while the Soul is holding the body or the body is traveling after it has been thrown.

hold.name: Hold
hold.description:
Only has an effect when playing as Tainted ??? .
Removes Tainted ???'s leftmost poop, storing it inside of the jar and cycling to the next poop.
Using Hold while a poop is inside it will remove the poop and use it as expected.

keeper s sack.name: Keeper's Sack
keeper s sack.description:
On pickup Spawns 3 random coins and 1 Key .
While held Grants stat upgrades for each item/pickup purchased with money. It can give the following upgrades:
• +0.5 damage.
• +0.25 range.
• +0.03 speed.
Every 3¢ spent in a shop will give boosts to a specific stat, going in the order of damage -> range -> speed.
Buying 15¢ items gives the same amount of stats as buying 5 3¢ items.

keeper s box.name: Keeper's Box
keeper s box.description:
Spawns a random Shop pickup or item that must be bought for its normal shop price. The item will be chosen from the Shop item pool.
Has an equal ~11.1% chance to spawn a card, pill, bomb, key, battery, item, soul heart, red heart, or a grab bag.
If used inside of a Devil Room, pickups will be surrounded by spikes that damage Isaac for a full heart, and items will cost hearts.

keeper s kin.name: Keeper's Kin
keeper s kin.description:
While in a room with enemies, rocks and obstacles will occasionally spawn Blue Spiders.
Causes 0-2 Blue Spiders to spawn when destroying a rock.

everything jar.name: Everything Jar
everything jar.description:
Spawns a different pickup based on the number of charges the item had when used:
• 1: poop.
• 2: Penny .
• 3: Bomb .
• 4: Key .
• 5: Heart .
• 6: pill.
• 7: card, rune, or soul stone.
• 8: Soul Heart .
• 9: Gold Heart .
• 10: Golden Key .
• 11: Golden Bomb .
If the item was fully charged, it instead does one of the following:
• Spawns a random amount of various pickups.
• Spawns a neutral fly.
• Spawns a bunch of friendly Dips, Blue Flies, and Blue Spiders.
• Closes the room's doors and spawns random enemies in front of each door, including Secret Room entrances.
• Spawns an item pedestal that cycles between 9 different items, 30 times per second, Items are selected from the current room's item pool.
• Spawns many different colored beams of light that deal damage to enemies and scale with Isaac's damage.
• Fills the room with poop.
• Spawns 6 Troll Bombs .
• Invokes the effects of Dataminer .
• Spawns a bunch of Shopkeepers.
• Spawns a Giga Bomb pickup that has a chance to be lit and explode.
• Does nothing.

tmtrainer.name: TMTRAINER
tmtrainer.description:
On pickup Petrifies all enemies in the room and sets them on fire.
Fades out the music, making it silent until another music track starts playing.
While held Causes all future items to become glitched, causing them to become random combinations of 2-3 effects based on other items, as well as effects that are not normally controlled by Isaac, such as enemy spawns.
Item sprites are also combined from other item sprites, often appearing in different colors.
This does not apply to quest items.
Glitched items can be either active or passive. There is a 75% chance for them to be passive.
Random effects can be assigned on random events, such as upon taking damage, enemy death, room clear, etc.
Glitched items will have random prices in shops.

anima sola.name: Anima Sola
anima sola.description:
Chains down the nearest enemy, completely preventing them from acting for 5 seconds.
Using the item again, even if not fully charged, will release the enemy immediately.
The effect also works on enemies that are invulnerable.
When playing as Tainted Jacob 
The chain will always be set on Dark Esau, if he is present. Releasing Dark Esau will immediately cause him to charge at Tainted Jacob.
Dark Esau deals no contact damage to Jacob while chained down.
If used in a room without any enemies before Dark Esau has spawned, it will immediately summon him without wasting a charge.

spindown dice.name: Spindown Dice
spindown dice.description:
Rerolls all items in the current room by subtracting their internal ID number by 1 until a valid item is rolled.
Locked items and items with the hidden tag are skipped.
To check which item is next in the reroll queue, see the item left from the desired item in the item list.
Items that are generated via this type of reroll are not removed from item pools and can be found again during the run, unless picked up.

hypercoagulation.name: Hypercoagulation
hypercoagulation.description:
Taking damage or donating health makes a red heart launch out of Isaac that disappears after 1.5 seconds.
The heart depends on the amount of health spent: half heart spent will produce half a heart, while a full heart will produce a full heart.
Damage sources that scale up from half a heart to a full heart, starting from Chapter 4, will still only produce half a heart.
No hearts are spawned when spending heart containers in Devil Deals.

ibs.name: IBS
ibs.description:
After dealing enough damage to enemies, Isaac begins to flash red. Once this happens, releasing the fire button activates one of Tainted ??? 's unique poop abilities.
IBS cannot activate if Isaac is currently holding a poop.

hemoptysis.name: Hemoptysis
hemoptysis.description:
Double-tapping a fire button causes Isaac to sneeze blood that deals damage to enemies in front of him and knocks back pickups, enemies and projectiles.
The amount of damage the sneeze does is equal to 1.5x Isaac's damage.
Enemies knocked back take 8 + 2 × CurrentFloor damage if they hit a wall or an obstacle, and deal the same damage to other enemies they hit.
The sneeze has a cooldown period of 1 second.
The sneeze applies a Brimstone curse to enemies for 5 seconds which makes them take more damage from Brimstone-like laser beams and explode on death from such an attack, damaging and spreading the curse to nearby enemies.
The amount of damage cursed enemies receive from lasers is equal to 2 × DamageStat + 3 . This damage also applies to lasers shot by enemies.
The range of the sneeze attack is affected by Isaac's shot speed.

ghost bombs.name: Ghost Bombs
ghost bombs.description:
+5 Bombs.
Causes Isaac's bombs to create ghosts when they explode, that rapidly chase and deal contact damage to enemies equal to 50% of Isaac's damage per tick, 3.75 times per second.
Ghosts explode after 10 seconds, dealing 7 damage to nearby enemies up to 3 times, and destroying enemy projectiles. Isaac and the environment are immune to the explosion.

gello.name: Gello
gello.description:
Spawns a familiar that's attached to Isaac, and can be controlled in the direction Isaac is shooting. While Isaac is shooting, the familiar will shoot at the closest enemy.
The familiar inherits Isaac's damage, tears, range, shoot speed, tear effects, and tear modifiers.
Launching the familiar deals 3x Isaac's damage to enemies it hits.
Gello's tears deal 75% of Isaac's damage, or 100% if playing as Lilith or Tainted Lilith .

decap attack.name: Decap Attack
decap attack.description:
Throws Isaac's head, allowing him to shoot from the spot it lands. The head will block enemy shots and deal contact damage. The body cannot shoot tears while the head is detached.
The head does 24 damage on impact and 4 damage per tick (12 per second) while on the ground.
The head can return to Isaac by touching it, or by using the item again which won't waste charges. Both throwing and retaking the head deals 24 damage to enemies passing through.
Has a 1% chance of being dropped upon defeating Chimera.

stye.name: Stye
stye.description:
Tears fired from Isaac's right eye gain the following:
+28.6% damage.
+6.5 range.
-0.3 shot speed.

mom s ring.name: Mom's Ring
mom s ring.description:
On pickup Drops a random rune or soul stone.
While held +1 damage.
